heisig_chinese_memo: Zeus ran out of lightning bolts and has to drop darts from the heavens.
heisig_story: When shot high into the heavens, the dart gets so small it looks like a mere drop. Although this character could as well mean "arrow," it has no connection with the primitive of that meaning. Hence the new key word.
koohiiStory1: Zeus ran out of lightning bolts and has to drop darts from the heavens.
koohiiStory2: Do not mistake with LOSE Â§±.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The arrow radical and the arrow kanji are the same. Sort of a "straight" shot to memorizing this kanji, you know?
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Just know your radicals and you'll know this kanji!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
To remember the reading „ÇÑ we use the word ‚ÄúYankees‚Äù (like the evil baseball team, go M‚Äôs!).
What is this arrow doing? It‚Äôs following around all the Yankee („ÇÑ) baseball players, stalking them, waiting to make its move (I‚Äôll let you decide what its ‚Äúmove‚Äù is).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the arrow as a human-sized living thing with legs, arms, and clothes, though. Strangely, it‚Äôs able to walk around even though it's an arrow. It has some kind of agenda. Make it a bit evil, if you can. What a strange thing‚Ä¶

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Zeus ran out of lightning bolts and has to drop darts from the heavens.
origin_of_ch_char_book: With the sound of the drums, once the battle started, the sky would be covered with flying arrows from both directions. (Ëá≥, zhi=chih, to; till) shows a target and an arrow coming down (Áü¢). Together, the characters form the word ‚Äúto get somewhere‚Äù.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The ancient Chinese character " vector " resembles the shape of an arrow, and the dysprosium, twig and feathers of the arrow are clearly visible. Jia Jinwen, Warring States bamboo slips may be upside down. The original meaning is arrow. " Yin " used to use the word " vector " to express its meaning, so the two characters are originally the same. Later, " yin " was added with "Âè£" in the middle of the character shape, and it was divided into two characters. See " Yin ". "Said the text": ".. Arrow, crossbow arrow also from the entrance, like dysprosium Gua feather-shaped ancient Yi Mou early as the vector where the vector are all from the vector.." Click " vector " is not from ' the ' , And the "Yi Mou" mentioned by Xu Shen is said to be a courtier of the Yellow Emperor, who was responsible for the creation of the arrow. "Composer": "Swing the bow, and the barbarian will be the arrow."

The oracle bone inscription " arrow " is used as the original meaning, referring to the arrow. "Compilation" 36481 is positive: "ÂúÖ50, arrow..." The inscriptions are incomplete, except that the previous article mentions military items such as armor and their quantity. For example, "ÂúÖ" is installed From the bag of arrows, we can see that " arrow " refers to arrows. On the other hand, the " vector " also refers to the display. "Collection" 10899 reverses: "the vector" refers to the captured objects on display. "Er Ya. Interpretation of the First ": "Shi, Chen Ye."

Bronze script is also used as the original meaning, referring to arrows, [Dong Ge] £™ï: "Fu (captive) military soldiers: shield, spear, Ge, bow, equipment (ÁÆô), arrow", refers to the capture of foreign weapons: shields, spears , Ge, bow, tools for holding arrows, arrows. Also used as the name of the country, Yabai is only the father of Guiyi: "Yabai (bo) is only (received) as the father of Guiyi."

The " arrow " or " shit " in the "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips" unearthed in recent times. For example, in the document "closed diagnosis style" involving forensic appraisal, there are "left arrows" and "xia left arrows weak (drowning)" Etc. In the literature handed down, " vector " as though through " feces of the most famous examples of" nurturing "Historical Records. In the Biographies of Lian Po Lin Xiangru, it is recorded that the envoy of Zhao State slandered Lian Po Yifan's "Three Left Arrows" because of bribery.

Arrow: Liu Shi. Bow arrow. Some (d?) have a target. Arrowhead.
Oath: We will never change (swear to be determined and never change).
Integrity: Yayan (righteous speech).
Display: "Male Yayu Yutang".
Shibu: "Zhiqi Wende".
Chips used in ancient pot pitching (a kind of entertainment).
Gu Tong "shit", feces.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†] [sh«ê]
["Guangyun" style visual cut, decree, book. ]
Also known as "Á¨∂1".
(1) An ancient weapon, the arrow. Made of wood or bamboo.
(2) Chips used in games such as ancient throwing pots or barnyard grasses.
(3) Straight and straight.
(4) The extension refers to integrity; steadfastness.
(5) Swear.
(6) Give; implement.
(7) Statement; Chen Xian.
(8) Be surly; behave.
(9) Through "shit".
(10) Through "relaxation". destruction.

Meaning Mnemonic
The arrow radical and the arrow kanji are the same. Sort of a "straight" shot to memorizing this kanji, you know?
Just know your radicals and you'll know this kanji!
